snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo this week will propose steps to strengthen New York State’s historically weak response to abuse of disabled people who live in publicly financed homes.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo will propose creating an agency dedicated to investigating problems with the care of nearly one million disabled New Yorkers; new law enforcement agency will strengthen the state's chronically weak response to abuse of disable people who live in publicly financed homes.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo this week will propose steps to strengthen New York State’s historically weak response to abuse of disabled people who live in publicly financed homes.
